relationships.evidence: They were so sure, I mean the Grossman's and the people at Columbia were so sure that I would go with Columbia because that had Dylan and Peter Paul and Mary Janice Joplin and just collecting them like that.

Joe Boyd was a vital link between the US and UK counterculture and musical underground from the mid-sixties through the early seventies, during which time Janis Joplin was active.
Gravinitis wrote the song 'Buried by the Blues' for Janis Joplin, and she was ready to record the vocals for it when she died.
